channel.title: Best anti-virus?
channel.description:
I tried kaspersky but it sucked. Nod32 is alright.
I want an antivirus that is good and has spyware protection too. I also want it to not eat CPU since I have a Pentium 3 and one that doesn't need a restart when it updates.
Please post suggestions and why, thanks.

item.title: Best anti-virus?
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

oh thats why MIRC doesn’t work for me

Read full topic

item.title: Best anti-virus?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Guy has sense!

However I don’t use an AV or a firewall.

I did use NOD32 for a number of years but the current version fucks up mIRC even withit set to exclude :’(

Common sense is my current AV protocol. Anything remotely suspicous Jotti it!

Read full topic

item.title: Best anti-virus?
item.dc:creator: @Aaron2 Aaron;
item.description:
@Aaron2 wrote:

[quote=“llib, post:123, topic:184980”]Well obviously the best anti-virus programs are Windows Live OneCare and Norton…just go to Moparscape, everyone there proudly displays pictures of scans with it.

I’m actually a bit confused at this concept, you try and prove something doesn’t have any viruses…so you scan it with OneCare or Norton? [/quote] onecare is Pretty good norton /fail, but i think my favorite has to be Nod32, and second favorite Avg 8.0 professional

item.title: Best anti-virus?
item.dc:creator: @oliver1205 oliver1205
item.description:
@oliver1205 wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:114, topic:184980”][quote author=oliver1205 link=topic=246687.msg2178151#msg2178151 date=1207892495]
i use micrsoft live one care. flame it all you want but i love it
[/quote]

And that’s why you’ll remain a ignorant little queef. One care is only good for showing how easily you can bypass it. The piece of shit is a pain in the ass when you have Vista, with all of the permission alerts, and that. It’s like breaking through a nuclear fallout shelter just to save a document in notepad.[/quote]

well i havent been infected yet and do have vista, so blow me nerd.

Read full topic

item.title: Best anti-virus?
item.dc:creator: @Zaron Zaron
item.description:
@Zaron wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:112, topic:184980”][quote author=Zaron link=topic=246687.msg2173402#msg2173402 date=1207729124]
wow, your a web developer, pretty amazing you have that and still a dick… please, just stop talking to me, really… you very annoying
[/quote]

How does that even make sense. I would say a web developer is more than likely going to be a male, as very few females have interest in it.

Just because you can get away with being an idiot, spamming, and flaming on moparscape, doesn’t mean you can here. As others have said, go somewhere else. Clearly you shouldn’t be here.[/quote]

well first, they spammed first, second one care isnt that good because it doesn’t really do much…

Read full topic

item.title: Best anti-virus?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:115, topic:184980”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=246687.msg2178426#msg2178426 date=1207900661]

i use micrsoft live one care. flame it all you want but i love it

And that’s why you’ll remain a ignorant little queef. One care is only good for showing how easily you can bypass it. The piece of shit is a pain in the ass when you have Vista, with all of the permission alerts, and that. It’s like breaking through a nuclear fallout shelter just to save a document in notepad.
[/quote]
ROFL, I installed it once, by accident when I was installed WLM, and it started spewing out UAC messages every time I clicked something. That’s when I switched to NOD32, which as a matter of fact, has never given me ANY messages what so ever.[/quote]
NOD32 is pretty nice, it’s resident shield or however you call it works really well

Read full topic
